page.title: 07Birds at school,Arden
page.content: Muirland School is in the middle of the country side. Outside the classroom window is a bird table. Many tits come to feed on the nut bag. Blue tits and great tits are the most common. A coal tit comes as well and occasionally a long tailed tit. There are a lot of chaffinches and some greenfinches too. The robin is often seen and sometimes comes into the classroom. The wren is a shy bird and stays in the bushes. The dunnock is shy too and feeds on the ground. Blackbirds and starlings also visit the bird table and sometimes a thrush will come. Last winter a number of fieldfare and redwing were seen in the school playground.
